metadata.name: Resilience  #192
metadata.description:
Resilience is a collection of endless architectures.
In a resilient generative system composed of multiple compatible parts, real-time information exchange enables open reconfigurations and continuous discrete adjustments. Sometimes vague and fuzzy, sometimes real and tangible, they reveal different readings of architectural complexity and scale: from city plans to floor plans and details to sections and elevations.

Resilience comes in a variety of polychrome palettes, ascii glyphs, and styles. 
To enjoy it in full-screen mode, press the left mouse button in live mode, for a monochrome look press 'b'. Made with P5js.

Resilience Generative Token by @grasser_alex 2022

metadata.name: stigmergy #139
metadata.description:
Stigmergy is a method of decentralized organization in which agents communicate by leaving traces in a shared environment. This piece simulates a kind of stigmergy among a large population of particles. Each particle leaves a trail behind it as it moves, and determines its direction of motion based on the trails around it. The rules for how a particle should move based on its surroundings were created with a user-guided evolutionary process.

Press "c" to capture a 2048x2048 image of the simulation. You can also press the spacebar to pause/unpause the simulation, and press "n" while paused to move the simulation forward a single step.

objkt.name: The sign of a generative civilization #100

issuer.name: The sign of a generative civilization

metadata.name: serendipity vs consequence #114
metadata.description:
This work is the result of a deterministic algorithm which manifests differently depending on the device it is viewed upon.  

The basis for the project is a phenomenon called z-fighting, a common issue in 3d graphics that appears when two or more objects overlap in 3d space. The graphic drivers on a device cannot determine which  object is closer or farther from the viewpoint since they were in exactly the same place. If we consider reality to be a continuum including our physical and digital experiences, z-fighting is a strictly digital phenomenon as objects trying to occupy the same physical space usually have tragic or intimate consequences.

The work in the current generative art movement is based on deterministic algorithms. This means that given a set of input parameters, the result should be exactly the same. This ideal is hardly ever the case as the code behind the art goes through different processing steps, on different CPUs, rendered on different GPUs, and interpreted by different graphics drivers. The code in this project is deterministic, it includes no conditions to adapt one way or the other to any particular hardware device, yet due to how the varying hardware and software devices try to mitigate z-fighting, this same code generates an entirely different experience on different devices.

To further exploit the nuances of these consequences, this work generates an audio score based on the generated graphics, analysing the canvas with a clustering algorithm and converting color values to notes, volume, and distortion.

A back-end system has been developed to render out each iteration across a variety of devices. To explore this catalog, please visit: 
https://fraguada.net/svsc/

More information about the project in the fx(text) article:
https://www.fxhash.xyz/article/serendipity-vs-consequence

Slowly developed between May 2022 and March 2023.

~interacting~

click or tap on the artwork canvas to enable audio. audio starts a few seconds after initiating the work.

~ui~
double click or double tap to open the project ui

⤡ - toggle fullscreen
img - save png. please wait for the capture to complete
vid - save webm. saves a 34 second clip with audio

~console~
open the development console on desktop browser for more information on the iteration

The console includes more information about a particular iteration, including parameter values, palette information, and information on some url params you can play with.
Once the audio starts, you can also see an audio score as coloured bars.

~acknowledgements~

To my family and friends for allowing me time and giving me support throughout the development of this project.

~license~

This artwork would not be possible without the collective efforts of many individuals developing open source software. 

three.js, tone.js, RecordRTC, chroma.js, skmeans, html2canvas, file-saver, ua-parser.js

metadata.name: glory hole$ #330
metadata.description:
our consciousness as humans can be distilled into a crudely fashioned hole at an abandoned dave & busters and the meditative state that is endured while sitting on a neglected toilet praying for the sound of disrupted waters. glory holes embody anonymity and pleasure for pleasure's sake. they are creations that cannot be destroyed, as they exist in the memories of anyone who uses or witnesses. many speculate that the carving of the hole is the purest form of human ingenuity and the desire to explore the unknown. formerly limited to the physical space. these glory holes transcend space and time. and exist in that same unknown that tempts us all. legalize ground beef. create nothing. consume everything.

HUGE thank you to @PureSpider for the layered PNG template, this dream would not have been realized without you friend.

attributes.name: Hats
attributes.value: touch of grey for men blonde

metadata.name: BRUTALIST MOVEMENT #92
metadata.description:
Inspired and fascinated by Brutalism, Modernism and Bauhaus, I've started to explore the deeper connections of architecture using pixel art in a clean, minimalistic and unique way.

The BRUTALIST MOVEMENT project represents the next step in this process. It's an animated generative experiment that focuses on finding the simplest and fewest components that - when generated randomly - always create structures resembling buildings: from small modern houses through industrial facilities to gigantic brutalist monuments.

This resulted in 4 main components: Base, Extension, Gap and Window. These entities are used randomly to create Blocks that form the final structure. 
The whole process is also strictly accompanied by 4 distinct components to hold colors and to be set by randomly chosen palettes: Sky, Sun, Shadow, Window.

Features consist of a mixture of the above components.

The project is animated to show how the buildings come to life. It's also a nice way to show what's going on in the background, because from time to time a bigger block would surely hide interesting smaller ones :) 

Press these keys:
's' - to download a larger resolution PNG
'n' - to shuffle through the 'depth' of Blocks, aka placing them from front to back and vice versa. This is a nice feature to show structures hidden by others and also a cool way to create iterations inside the iteration - sub-iterations - we can say :)
'r' - to reset the Blocks' depths to default

Please note:
Everything you see is generated, animated and drawn real-time. No layered transparent PNGs, PFP or similar!

Have fun and inspiration!


@cloudnoise © 2022

☁︎

Created with P5.js library.

metadata.name: SURFERS #50
metadata.description:
Subscription token for 12 issues of The Tickle - weekly magazine for contemporary digital art and creative writing (@inwarhol), with this special limited edition created by itsgalo (@galoandstuff) titled "SURFERS".

Collect this token, and receive 12 issues - each issue is airdropped to your wallet every Friday!
Holders become members of The Tickle Subscribers Club, gaining access to exclusive airdrops of free art from our featured artists!

Collect multiple tokens to increase your subscription beyond 12 weeks!

————————————

SURFERS is a generative animated painting made from pixel array computations and modulo functions. It is an exploration of various dithering effects and the rhythmic qualities of pixel transformations.

Press ’s’ to save an animated GIF.
Made with P5.js and GLSL. By @galoandstuff.

metadata.name: Proto alphabet #30
metadata.description:
For more than 4000 years, before Lineal A in Crete, proto alphabets were created. They freed man from the chains of evolution and gave a way to record the rhythm of the passage of time.

As recursion generates a grammar, recursion generates the strokes that shape the following proto alphabets, which attempt to record the passage of time.

Time is the substance I am made of. Time is a river which sweeps me along, but I am the river; it is a tiger which destroys me, but I am the tiger; it is a fire which consumes me, but I am the fire. - Jorge Luis Borges


Desde hace más de 4000 años, antes Lineal A en Creta, proto alfabetos fueron creados. Liberaron al hombre de las cadenas de la evolución y dieron una forma para registrar el ritmo del paso del tiempo.

Como la recursividad genera una gramática, la recursividad genera los trazos que dan forma a los siguientes proto alfabetos, los cuales intentan registrar el paso del tiempo.

El tiempo es la sustancia de que estoy hecho. El tiempo es un río que me arrebata, pero yo soy el río; es un tigre que me destroza, pero yo soy el tigre; es un fuego que me consume, pero yo soy el fuego. - Jorge Luis Borges


Controls (in live view):
- Press s to get a PNG file
- Press S to get a SVG file

Artwork by x0y0z0 @x0y0z0tn (2023)

metadata.name: Taiga #90
metadata.description:
Generate Tall pines, spruces in atmospheric environment. I need to draw anything I feel around, any story, any relations and any environment. colors are beautiful but can not describe many moments and many atmospheres. this gray scale feeling is about my world. Feeling full of loneliness and sadness, but I know it's generated in my mind. it's not real!

All is generative! Features and variations exist in tree types, atmosphere background-foregrounds, flyings.

=========== Controls ===========
🔸 Press F key to change view.
🔸 Press S key to save high resolution image.

metadata.name: On the sea, I ... #26
metadata.description:
Generative painting based on churning waves with floating buoys. Represented in three different media.

Features:
- Three drawing styles: "watercolor" 70%, "brush" 30%, or "block" 70%
- Warm white or blue waves
- Variable border and column sizes
- Number of columns
- Calm waves at the edges or center
- Color 80% or red 20% buoys
- Buoy drawing style, "watercolor" or "brush"

Viewing in desktop Chrome is recommended for the best results.
Press ’s’ to save a screenshot. Image size is 928x1200px
Press ’p’ to pause/resume.

Add '&size=#' to the end of the live view URL to render a variation of your edition at a resolution up to 3,000 px. 

Copyright (c) 2022 Matt Perkins, hello@mattperkins.me, @nudoru on Twitter. Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0, see LICENSE.txt for more information.

metadata.name: stigmergy #7
metadata.description:
Stigmergy is a method of decentralized organization in which agents communicate by leaving traces in a shared environment. This piece simulates a kind of stigmergy among a large population of particles. Each particle leaves a trail behind it as it moves, and determines its direction of motion based on the trails around it. The rules for how a particle should move based on its surroundings were created with a user-guided evolutionary process.

metadata.name: Tranquility #20
metadata.description:
There was an original meaning to this piece, but it washed away over time, nevertheless Tranquility is a representation of the challenges of connecting to others and the resilience required to navigate the complexity of human relationships. Tranquility features sharp and dynamic lines that result in intricate and often chaotic patterns (conveying the intensity and complexity of the human experience).

Generative artwork - www.petitsapin.com
Press "s" in live view to download high-res version.

metadata.name: Strata Lines #21
metadata.description:
Lines in black and white that emulate rock strata formation.
The parameters are randomly selected from a pool of 32 hand picked combinations for the spread, width and scale.

Each piece is unique.

Coded with p5js.

Original artwork by William Watkins · Lyon, 2021
